column4: As a windows refugee, here's a bit of a n00b question: Running ext3, am I going to have to ever 'defrag' my partitions?
1) Believe it or not, there's no standard ext3 defragger 2) In most cases, fragmentation doesn't hurt performance all that much in ext3
If you still want to defrag, you can use e2defrag, but will have to convert the filesystem back to ext2 first
Not really. My boot time is laughably fast now that I've edited the rc.d files and switched to xfce. I've got to say, I really don't understand why xfce isn't more popular.
